name: Special Topics: Statistical Machine Learning
long_desc: Data mining is the science of discovering patterns and learning structure in large data sets.  Covered topics include  clustering, dimension reduction, regression, classification, and decision trees.

custom_fields.goals: After taking the class, when faced with a new research problem, students should be able to 1 select appropriate methods of predictive modeling andor structure discovery, and justify their choice, 2 use and program statistical software to implement those methods, and 3 critically evaluate the results and communicate them to professional colleagues who are not also statisticians or dataanalysts.
custom_fields.key_topics: Discovering patterns and learning structure in large data sets; clustering, dimension reduction, regression, classification, decision trees, evaluation of predictive models, social implications of data mining.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Theory and practice of linear regression; mathematical statistics; probability; basic statistics and data analysis; linear algebra; calculus in multiple variables; some practical experience with data analysis (preferably using R).
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Weekly homework assignments, in-class exercises, online reading quizzes, take-home exams, in-class exams.
custom_fields.relevance: Students will learn how to choose, implement and interpret the results of data-mining techniques, and have some awareness of controversies about their appropriate use.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: None, but you should expect to spend the full6 hours/week outside of class meetings implied by this being a 9-unit course in some combination of reading and homework.
